intro: Spiesia nivea, commonly known as the white spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many other spurge species. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting well to dry conditions. Spiesia nivea is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
